definition: to fall head over heels/(fig.) to come a cropper
to grow/to plant/to insert/to force on sb/to fall head first
heel/to follow closely/to go with/(of a woman) to marry sb/with/compared with/to/towards/and (joining two nouns)
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.chinese: 人都有栽跟頭的時候，這就是生活。

sentences.english: Dishonest people are bound to come a cropper in the end.
sentences.chinese: 不老實的人到頭來總是要栽跟頭的。

sentences.english: Good heavens, the impish son is falling this time.
sentences.chinese: 天啊，小鬼子這次是要栽跟頭了。

sentences.english: Which economy will be the first to stumble on its problems?
sentences.chinese: 哪個經濟體將是頭一個在自己的問題上栽跟頭的？

sentences.english: He is too clever by half, is that young man; one of these days he'll come a cropper .
sentences.chinese: 這小夥子未免太聰明瞭一點，總有一天他要栽跟頭的。
